definitions.definition: to go away from a place or person in order to escape from fighting or danger:
examples: Attacks by enemy aircraft forced the tanks to retreat (from the city).

definitions.definition: to go to a quiet safe place in order to avoid a difficult situation:
examples: When he's done something wrong, he retreats to his bedroom.

definitions.definition: a move back by soldiers or an army, either because they have been defeated or in order to avoid fighting:
a period of time used to pray and study quietly, or to think carefully, away from normal activities and duties:
examples: We went on (a) retreat at/to a monastery in Wales.
